repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Railroad Memorabilia #6039 MB. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives 227 Ives Hall Tower Road Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183 kheelref@cornell.edu https://catherwood.library.cornell.edu/kheel/

did.unittitle: Conductor's coat buttons ; M & St. L.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gold buttons from rail road uniforms. Metal button covers, covering plastic buttons, with M&ST.L (Minneapolis & St. Louis Railroad) stamped in the metal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Chrome Conductor's punch for letter "S"

did.unittitle: Souvenir token, and coin ; Souvenir coin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "100th Anniversary of the Golden Spike Ceremony at Promontry Summit, May 10, 1869 - May 10, 1969. May God continue the unity of our country as this railroad unites the 2 great oceans of the world." National Fraternal Congress of America, 84th Annual Convention, Atlanta, Georgia, coin in a case. "Golden Spike Centennial, May 10, 1869-1969". Other side: "A Golden Link for Progress, Union Pacific/Central Pacific, America United by Rail".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Selective Service System, World War II, Awarded in the name of the Congress of the U.S. for Faithful and Loyal Service". Push pin, pin and medal with ribbon, blue and gold in color. Buttons with "Stop Rail Mergers" written on them. Laminated plastic over metal. Silver and black metal buttons, with "CUT" stamped in the metal on top. Gold button with "N.Y.C." stamped on top.

did.unittitle: Southern Pacific Railroad - Patches ; Union felt patch ; Union button

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cloth union patches from the Southern Pacific Railroad. "Employee Involvement- Transportation Problem Solving" ; Felt union patch, white background with green, red, brown and black coloring in the picture. Initials on the patch "S.T.F.R.M." Metal button with laminated plastic covering. Colored lettering saying "Pocatello Centennial, 1882-1982, Union Pacific Growing Together" ; Metal button with laminated plastic covering. Yellow background with black lettering "MO-PAC hauls all"

did.unittitle: Souvenir gold coin ; Centennial Medallion of the Illinois Central Railroad

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Golden Spike Centennial Celebration Commission ; Sacramento 1869-1969, Promontory Omaha. The Ocean United by Railway. The Central Pacific & Union Pacific Railroads Linking the Nation. Promontory Summit, Utah. The Pacific Railway is Completed, May 10, 1869". Gold coin in box and information pamphlet. Bronze medallion, with "For 100 Years Illinois Central Main Line of Mid-America" stamped on one side. And a picture of the Eastern and Central half of the United States stamped on the other side, with leaf detail on the edge. A pamphlet enclosed to give details about the medallion all in a felt lined box.

did.unittitle: Switch key ; Conductor emblem, insignia ; Watch fob

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Switch key dated Oct. 1903 from the B & M Railroad Co. "B&M R.R." is stamped on the key. Key is in felt lined case. Metal 'patch'/emblem saying Conductor on it, with the seal from "The Minneapolis & St. Louis Railroad Co. The Peoria/Gateway Line" ; Watch fob made up of an oval metal piece with "Philadelphia, Bethlehem and New England" stamped on it, Yellow with red lettering, hanging on a small brown leather strap.

did.unittitle: Rail road spike ; Small dish, ashtray ; Switch lock (these items lose in box)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Square steel railroad spike. White dish with scalped edges, gold trim around the outside rim and around the inside 'bottom'. Colored picture of the Northern Pacific Depot, Missoula, Mont., with that written in black lettering under the picture. Switch lock off EJ&E Railroad - donated by Mr. Claude Foster - Local #557

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Lake Shore & Michigan Southern Railway Co. employee's monthly passes from 1888, 1889, 1890.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Union Pacific Railroad Co., Dining Car and Hotel Department, Railway Employee's Meal Book. Value $5.00, Book number 072480, there is just one ticket left in the ticket book, issued Jan. of 1946.

did.unittitle: Railway trip passes for The Pennsylvania Railroad ; The Western Pacific Railroad Company ; Ferrocarriles Nacionales de Mexico y Anexos ; New York Central System ; Wabash Railroad Company ; United Transportation Union

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Paper tickets, passes, issued to ride the rail roads. Alson included - Traveling card ; Membership card ;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Complete menu offered on the Southern Pacific Lines in October of 1962.

did.unittitle: Declaration of "Kate Shelley Week" in the state of Iowa

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of the Proclamation made by Governor Leo A. Hoegh declaring the week of July 1 to 7, 1956 as "Kate Shelley Week", in honor of her heroism.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Union Pacific Railroad Co. Passenger's Packet. Containing 4 train schedules (different), 1 Dining menu, 1 paper on Santa Fe train service, 3 SF-LA, San Diego "trip logs" (same), 2 ticket stubs, all enclosed in an envelope.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A 3 cent postage stamp "Honoring Railroad Engineers of America".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Railroad employee passes from various railroad companies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Black and white photo of a train covered with snow, made into a postcard.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Black and white photo of a train wreck made into a postcard. Writing in bottom left corner "Wreck of Train 7 Trout Lake, Aug. 7th, 1912, Ste. Marie Line. Special photo by Peters."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Imperial Dinner, Rock Island Rail Road Menu, Sept. 13, 1952

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A, T, & SF Line, "The Grand Canyon Limited" dinner menu and wine list.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of a painting of woman and children standing by a train.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Originals and copies of cartoons pertaining to railroad men's jobs, from Olin D. Brooks, Local 560.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Beverage list for the Domeliners, Union Pacific Railroad.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two sided card with lyrics to songs to open & close meetings and for funerals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Paper ticket, pass, issued to ride the Seaboard Coast Line Railroad, Atlantic Coast Line Railroad, Conductor, between 1967-1972. Rules and regulations are stated on both front and back of the ticket as to proper use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One ticket for passage on the Ohio & Mississippi Railway, Aug. 14th, 1888, for Amanda Rodisill (on her wedding day). From Cincinnati, Ohio to Cisney, Illinois. Ticket no. 6203

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Card with song lyrics for opening, welcome, initiation, funeral march, closing, promotion and installation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photograph of a man standing beside a snow covered train turned into a postcard.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Menus for the Sante Fe Dining Car, California Limited, prepared by the Fred Harvey Service with pictures of paintings used for the coversheets.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Dining in Luxury on the Domeliners "City of Los Angeles" and "City of Portland"" Postcard

did.unittitle: Model of G-6 Automatic brake valve

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cardboard and plastic (flat) model of G-6 Automatic Brake Valve with descriptions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cardboard replica of a pin, with "T87" written on it. US Patent Nov. 26, 1901, British Patent Sept. 20, 1901

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Badge at top with pin back, has beige background with red and green lettering "B of L F E ORC". Ribbon is red, green and white striped with a small button in the center with the lettering "Brotherhood of Railroad Trainmen". Ribbon has gold lettering "State Joint 5th Sunday Meeting Pottsville, Pa., March 31, 1912"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Drawings of railroad engines by "Webb" Included are: John Bull, The Best Friend, Tom Thumb, Rocket, Stourbridge Lion, and Experiment.

did.unittitle: Model of S-6 Independent Brake Valve

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cardboard and plastic (flat) model of S-6 Independent Brake Valve with descriptions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stock certificate from the Old Colony Railroad Company, worth 2 shares ($100/ea.), dated February 4th, 1898

did.unittitle: Model of H-6 Automatic Brake Valve

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cardboard and plastic (flat) model of H-6 Automatic Brake Valve. Old and new design both shown and explained.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Stock certificate from the Old Colony and Newport Railway Company, worth 3 shares ($100/ea.), dated October, 1872 ; Receipt for the repair and inspection of a watch, dated Jan. 11, 1898.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Postcard of picture of a man with a train. Lettering on the postcard: " Ste. Marie Line, Firemen, Blake of the wreck. Train 7, Aug. 7th, 1912, Trout Lake. Special photo by Peters."

did.unittitle: Bonus memorandums from B&O.R.R. (Baltimore and Ohio Railroad Company)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Receipts from Baltimore and Ohio Railroad Company, for "Bonus Memorandum"

did.unittitle: Japanese Rail Exchange - Private Railway Workers' Union of Japan -- 11 pins (PRC)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: found in 5484, box 12

did.unittitle: Banner from the Order of Railway Conductors and Brakemen

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Banner made of yellow nylon with red lettering on both sides, and yellow fringe all around the outside. The lettering reads: "THE ORDER OF RAILWAY CONDUCTORS & BRAKEMEN FOUNDED 1868 GRAND DIVISION" Located in the center of the banner is the Conductors emblem, a circle divided in three sections, with red, green, white, and the symbols of a lock & pin ; arm wrapped in chain ; hand with conductor's punch stitched in black.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Banner, black velvet front, gold silk back. On the front is embroidery with the following initials "B of H P" "SUNA", "SMAA" "No.1" This is from the Switchmen's Union of North America, Kansas City, Local No. 1. Also acknowledged the Switchmen's Mutual Aid Association.

did.unittitle: Banner from the Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen. Erie Lodge 543.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Banner, appears handmade, red and white with navy lettering ; "B of L F and E" ; "Erie Lodge 543", in the center is a navy blue star with a white "3" in it.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bronze medallions, pin with red, white and green ribbon attached, medallions have stamped lettering and pictures. Top medallion is picture of a train station with "In Detroit life is worth living" stamped on it. Bottom medallion has a picture of a conductor and "Grand Division ORC, Div. '48" stamped on it. The banner a crossed the conductor has "1918" on it. There is a round emblem in the bottom left corner that is divided in three sections with the symbols for the railroad conductors union stamped in each section, (lantern, switch, and chain) this is colored the red, white and green.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Goggle like glasses, leather band, with plastic cups around the eyes. Metal covers hinged over eyepieces.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Blackball box, a wooden box with hinged top, and two holes one in each end for dropping in the marbles. Included are three marbles, two white, one black.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Brass pin with ribbon and medallion. Pin is brass, rectangular in shape with lettering "DELEGATE, 3rd Biennial Convention, 9th Session". The ribbon holding the medallion is red, white and green striped and triangular in shape. The medallion is round with lettering "Detroit, Mich., May 1907" . Stamped in the middle of the medallion is a "S" with the letters "UNA" across the center of the "S".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pin that is laminated plastic over metal. The background is white, with a red ring around the outside of the pin, and red lettering "B & O's New "Red Circle Day Fares" for Pullman Travel SAVE YOU more than 31%"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Switch key for the Charlotte Harbor & Northern Ry. Key has the initials "C.H. & N. RY" stamped in the ring.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Pin that is laminated plastic over metal. The background is white with a red flag, green flag, and red lantern depicted on it. And the lettering "B T R R" appearing in a spiked wheel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Round banner made of velvet and cotton/satin, with rope (braided red, green, white) dividing it into three sections and circling the outside edge. Tassels hang from the outside edge. In each section there are embroidered symbols, lock & pin ; arm wrapped in chain ; hand with conductor's punch and lantern. The sections are red, green and beige (originally white?).

did.unittitle: Piece of granite from 4 or 5 miles under the Mountains of Virginia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This piece of granite was dedicated to the Grand Lodge: by James K. Cox, President of Tug River Lodge 517, Tug River and North Fork Railroad Company. Cylinder in shape appears to have come from maybe a test hole for the railroad construction.

did.unittitle: Union Seal - SUNA, Mapleleaf Lodge No. 84, organized - Oct. 20, 1899, Lelwein, Iowa

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Official seal/stamp for SUNA, Mapleleaf Lodge No. 84, Lelwein, Iowa. The sealmaker is black with gold detailing.

did.unittitle: Union Seal - SUNA, Utica Lodge No. 44, organized - 2/24/1907, Utica, NY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Official seal/stamp for SUNA, Utica Lodge No. 44, Utica, NY. The sealmaker is black with gold detailing.

did.unittitle: Union Seal - SUNA, Buffalo, NY Lodge No. 4, organized - 4/29/1889, Buffalo, NY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Official seal/stamp for SUNA, Buffalo, NY Lodge No. 4, Buffalo, NY. The sealmaker is black with gold detailing.

did.unittitle: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen, Bartholdi Lodge No. 309, Long Island Railroad Company, organized, 3/21/1886

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Official seal/stamp for BLF & E, Bartholdi Lodge No. 309, Long Island Railroad Company. The sealmaker is black with gold detailing.

did.unittitle: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen, Argentine Lodge No. 99, Long Island Railroad Company, organized, Jun. 1920

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Official seal/stamp for BLF & E, Argentine Lodge No. 99, Long Island Railroad Company, organized, Jun. 1920. The sealmaker is black with gold detailing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Denim coat covered with sixty patches from various railroads.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Leather bound book with rules and regulations, used as the "Bible" of the O.R.C. (Order of the Railway Conductors and Brakemen)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Iron (varnished) link and pin.

did.unittitle: Blackball box, marbles, 2 wooden links and pins, and a set of hoodwinks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Black ball box with handle, with marbles, 13 white, and 4 black. Two wooden replicas of railway pins and links. One set of hoodwinks made of vinyl and velvet with cloth strap, plastic and metal eye covering.

did.unittitle: Union Seal - SUNA, Beacon Light Lodge No. 299, organized - 5/25, 1930, Cleveland, Ohio

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Official seal/stamp for SUNA, Beacon Light Lodge No. 299, Cleveland, Ohio

did.unittitle: Union Seal - SUNA, San Bernardino Lodge No. 22, organized - Sept. 1, 1945, San Bernardino, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Official seal/stamp for SUNA, San Bernardino Lodge No. 22, San Bernardino, Calif.

did.unittitle: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen, Merrick Lodge No. 563, Merrick, Mass., organized, Feb. 5, 1900

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Official seal/stamp for BLF & E, Merrick Lodge No. 563, Merrick, Mass. The sealmaker is black with gold detailing.

did.unittitle: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen, Forest City Lodge No. 70, Cleveland, Ohio, organized, Jan. 1870

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Official seal/stamp for BLF & E, Forest City Lodge No. 70 (Cleveland, Ohio). The sealmaker is black with gold detailing.

did.unittitle: Brotherhood of Locomotive Firemen and Enginemen, New York State Legislature Board, Chairman

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Official seal/stamp for BLF & E, New York State Legislative Board, Chairman. This sealmaker has a molded lions head with an open mouth holding the top half of the seal. The lions main is also molded as part of the sealmaker, and highlighted with gold detailing.

did.unittitle: Diagram of the organization of the New York and Erie Railroad

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Drawing of an "organization tree" - New York and Erie Railroad -- 'Diagram representing a plan of organization. Exhibiting the division of administrative duties and showing the number and class of employees. Engaged in each department from the returns of September 1855' -- Donated by Dr. Charles Wrege
